image.altText: Philip Lowe giving evidence, resting his head on his hand.

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank leaves interest rates steady at 4.1 per cent for the third month in a row, but says further increases to rates may be needed to bring down inflation in line with its target.

title.children: Interest rates remain on hold as Philip Lowe calls time on his seven-year stint as RBA governor

image.altText: Qantas CEO Alan Joyce speaks to the media during a press conference.

items.synopsis: Embattled Qantas boss Alan Joyce brings his retirement forward by two months after a horror period for the airline.

title.children: Alan Joyce abruptly departs Qantas after scandalous week and 'many ups and downs'

image.altText: A man in a suit stands and speaks at a microphone in parliament, with other politicians seated behind him.

items.synopsis: The government's relationship with Qantas and Richard Marles's use of taxpayer-funded flights are expected to dominate Question Time.

title.children: PM fends off questions about Qantas and Qatar decision in Question Time

image.altText: A golden crucifix

items.synopsis: Catholic Archdiocese of Canberra and Goulburn Chancellor Patrick McArdle made the comments at a federal Senate inquiry into a bill that would effectively force the ACT government to hold an inquiry into its own takeover of Calvary Public Hospital.

title.children: Catholic Church representative tells Senate inquiry the ACT doesn't have a 'right' to self-government

image.altText: A young boy is smiling in a red t-shirt.

items.synopsis: A Sydney court hears secret recordings in which William Tyrrell's former foster father appears to berate a child in an expletive-laden tirade as he fights charges of assault and intimidation.

title.children: Secret recordings of William Tyrrell's former foster parents played in court after house and car bugged for 12 months

image.altText: the four members of Smash Mouth pose with someone dressed as Shrek standing out on a grassy lawn

items.synopsis: Immortalised by Shrek and internet culture, Smash Mouth had a complex relationship with their success. The death of their frontman casts a not-so-fairytale ending to their legacy.

title.children: The strange, dark story of Smash Mouth and All Star

image.altText: A koala sits on the edge of a nursery table near a wooden post, looking towards a nearby collection of seedlings.

items.synopsis: After several months of illicit gorging at a NSW nursery, Claude the koala has been caught in the act.

title.children: Claude the leaf thief devours $6k worth of seedlings intended for koala habitat

image.altText: Close up of Alan Joyce

items.synopsis: Alan Joyce will leave Qantas after 15 years with $125 million, while the airline's operations have suffered and its reputation has been trashed, writes business editor Ian Verrender.

title.children: The never-ending spin that protected Alan Joyce and Qantas from reality has started to unravel

image.altText: Lidia Thorpe, wearing earrings in the colours of the Aboriginal flag, sits in the senate, she looks up to the left

items.synopsis: Independent senator Lidia Thorpe reveals her unlikely friendships with political adversaries, and says she was once approached by former Victorian premier Jeff Kennett to run for the Liberal Party.

title.children: Lidia Thorpe's self-confessed 'weird' Senate friendships

image.altText: Prime Minister Kalsakau and Penny Wong sign a security agreement

items.synopsis: The new prime minister of Vanuatu flags he wants to rewrite a security pact his predecessor signed with Australia, saying parliament is unlikely to ratify the agreement in its current form.

title.children: 'We are not pro-Chinese': Australia's security pact with Vanuatu to be 'revisited' under new PM

image.altText: An aerial image shows a volcanic island emitting white smoke surrounded by clear blue sea on a clear day.

items.synopsis: The judge overseeing a criminal trial into the deadly eruption of Whakaari White Island in 2019 dismisses charges against the three brothers who own the volcano, with proceedings set to continue over their company's involvement.

title.children: Judge in Whakaari White Island trial dismisses charges against brothers who own volcano

image.altText: A woman lies back in a chair smiling, while someone injects her forehead with a syringe.

items.synopsis: Australia's medical regulator says it is cracking down on cosmetic procedures such as botox and fillers, but those living with the long-term impacts of botched procedures say the focus has come too late.

title.children: Cosmetic surgery crackdown now targeting fillers, botox and other procedures

image.altText: Plastic playground equipment in the front yard of a childcare centre, seen through a metal fence.

items.synopsis: A child dies two days after being taken to Royal Darwin Hospital in a critical condition.

title.children: Police investigating death of toddler after medical incident at Darwin childcare centre

image.altText: male patient in transfer bed with padding over his injured eye

items.synopsis: Stephan Giersberg is "incredibly lucky" he didn't lose his eye when a nail lodged in his eyeball while he was renovating his home.

title.children: Home reno accident leaves nail 'sticking' in eye of WA handyman

image.altText: An undated photo of Frank Foley and his son, Shaun.

items.synopsis: Human remains located by a fossicker last year have been linked to Frank Foley's close-living relatives, and police will conduct a forensic search at the site today.

title.children: Queensland police hope 'offenders can be brought to justice' after cold case breakthrough

image.altText: Grange Road street sign

items.synopsis: Police say it appears a 14-year-old who suffered critical injuries in an alleged abduction at Glen Huntly in Melbourne's south-east was an "innocent victim" making his way home from school.

title.children: Police investigate after 'heinous attack' leaves Melbourne schoolboy critically injured

image.altText: A grey tabby feral cat against a background of red dirt.

items.synopsis: A new global report is released, providing the most comprehensive assessment on biological invasions to date.

title.children: Feral cats, rabbits and fire ants driving biodiversity loss in Australia, but report finds one success story

image.altText: A man with scarring on his face wearing a surgical mask is carried on a stretcher.

items.synopsis: Shinji Aoba, who nearly died from burns he sustained while starting the blaze, faces five charges including murder, attempted murder and arson.

title.children: Japanese man admits to starting anime studio fire that killed 36 people

image.altText: Dozens of photos, most arranged on top of each other, on a table

items.synopsis: Three decades after the legendary Queen frontman's death, more than 250 snaps from his personal albums are released publicly for the first time, painting a new picture of a world only his "nearest and dearest" knew until now.

title.children: Freddie Mercury's 'mythology busting' private photos revealed after 30 years

image.altText: A man wearing a jacket and collared shirt speaks at a press event.

items.synopsis: Ben Wyatt says the repeal of the controversial legislation was inevitable after consensus among the key players broke down, but he's surprised pastoralists want to revert to the old laws.

title.children: 'Regulations went too far': Architect of WA's Aboriginal cultural heritage laws says repeal was inevitable

image.altText: a man in a high-vis jacket loading cattle from a truck to a ship.

items.synopsis: Malaysia is once again accepting live cattle and buffalo exports from Australia. Will Indonesia follow suit?

title.children: Malaysia lifts suspension of live cattle and buffalo exports

image.altText: The tail of a Qantas plane in front of a Qantas shed on a tarmac at an airport.

items.synopsis: Qantas boss Alan Joyce announces he will leave the airline tomorrow, bringing forward his planned retirement by two months. The Reserve Bank keeps interest rates on hold today at 4.1 per cent. Follow live.

title.children: Joyce to leave Qantas tomorrow, bringing forward retirement by two months, RBA leaves interest rates on hold, ASX loses ground

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Thanks for joining us today and come back tomorrow when the latest economic growth figures are released. Tonight on The Business with Kirsten Aiken: A golden parachute for Alan Joyce but tough questions for the Qantas board and new CEO Vanessa Hudson. Corporate governance expert Helen Swinburne joins the program. The RBA leaves interest rates on hold at 4.1% after Philip Lowe's final monthly board meeting as Governor. And we get some reaction to the latest stimulus from China's policy makers attempting to prop up its ailing property sector. Watch ABC News at 8.44pm, after the late news on ABC TV, and anytime on ABC iView.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: That's all folks

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Here are the best and worst performers on the ASX 200:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: ASX 200 top movers

children.content: Here are the best and worst performers on the ASX 200:
ASX 200 top movers
(Refinitiv)

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: "It's not a legacy you would be proud of." That's the scathing view of Teri O'Toole from the Flights Attendants Association on departing Qantas boss Alan Joyce. She spoke to Ros Childs on ABC News Channel. "The board has made a good decision in deciding to end Alan's time a little early and give Vanessa an opportunity to come back in and really put her fingerprints on the airline." "I think some of the things that I have seen as a union head have been the decimation of the cabin crew community." "Certainly with the sacking of the 1,700 baggage handlers, that wasn't a great legacy either. " "So I'm probably a little skewed on my opinion of the legacy of Alan Joyce." Ms O'Toole is hopeful that a new chief executive will see better treatment of staff. "I think Vanessa has got a big job ahead of her, but I'm looking forward to some quick changes, making some changes on the IR agenda and how they deal with people, and hopefully that will then flow on to getting our customers back on board and the real Spirit of Australia that Qantas is."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 'Decimation of cabin crew community'

children.content: "It's not a legacy you would be proud of."
That's the scathing view of Teri O'Toole from the Flights Attendants Association on departing Qantas boss Alan Joyce.
She spoke to Ros Childs on ABC News Channel.
"The board has made a good decision in deciding to end Alan's time a little early and give Vanessa an opportunity to come back in and really put her fingerprints on the airline."
"I think some of the things that I have seen as a union head have been the decimation of the cabin crew community."
"Certainly with the sacking of the 1,700 baggage handlers, that wasn't a great legacy either. "
"So I'm probably a little skewed on my opinion of the legacy of Alan Joyce."
Ms O'Toole is hopeful that a new chief executive will see better treatment of staff.

"I think Vanessa has got a big job ahead of her, but I'm looking forward to some quick changes, making some changes on the IR agenda and how they deal with people, and hopefully that will then flow on to getting our customers back on board and the real Spirit of Australia that Qantas is."

image.altText: A drone shot of muddy tire tracks throughout a grassy field.

items.synopsis: Rangers in North Queensland have fined a four-wheel drive owner and towing company after their "deep wheel ruts" scared protected wetlands.

title.children: 4WD owner and towing company fined after treating wetlands as 'playground'

image.altText: a woman's hand holding a newborn baby's feet while in a maternity ward

items.synopsis: An upper house committee into the prevalence of birth trauma in New South Wales, expected to go for several months, received a record 4,000 submissions from the public.

title.children: 'Stop infantilising women': Birth trauma inquiry described as 'me too' moment for mothers in NSW on day one

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and sunglasses, with head bowed and arms crossed.

items.synopsis: Leeanne Eatts will seek a judge-only trial to face manslaughter charges after her two sons drowned in a North Queensland river.

title.children: Mother charged over sons' drownings to apply for judge-only trial

image.altText: India moon lander's view of the moon from space.

items.synopsis: The Indian Space Research Organisation will now focus on a sun research mission as the nation hopes to make its name in the field of space travel.

title.children: India puts moon rover to 'sleep' after successful mission

image.altText: Man in white shirt

items.synopsis: Jurors have been told not be to be tempted to be television detectives when deliberating the fate of a man police allege gave a toddler a fatal dose of an antidepressant.

title.children: Jury hears man charged over toddler's antidepressant death 'not sharpest knife in the drawer', but not a killer

image.altText: A seven-month-old boy with scratches on his face and head.

items.synopsis: Seven-month-old Jack had been left alone, unsupervised, in a room when he was beaten by another child. His mother is now pursuing legal action and lawyers say their caseload of injuries sustained at childcare centres is increasing.

title.children: Injuries sustained at childcare centres are on the rise. Experts say there's one common factor

image.altText: Kim Mo-Mi stands in her bedroom with a pink pearlescent mask on, stretching her arms out while dancing.

items.synopsis: Kim Mo-mi is living her sort-of best life working as an accountant by day and performing as internet sensation Mask Girl by night. But then someone discovers her true identity, and a serious of unfortunate events (murder!) take over her life.

title.children: The new Korean crime thriller you'll want to binge in one sitting

image.altText: A dark-haired boy standing on a boardwalk in bushland. His face is blurred and he cannot be identified.

items.synopsis: The boy's devastated family has been told he is likely to spend months in hospital. A 27-year-old man has been charged over the Sunshine Coast incident.

title.children: Boy, 12, on life support after being knocked off scooter by alleged drunk driver on Father's Day

image.altText: A boy looking at a cat in a washing basket.

items.synopsis: Chloe the cat's movements will likely remain a mystery but her owner says she is readjusting well to family life.

title.children: Adventurous cat missing since 2020 and thought dead reunited with owners
